properties.publicTransport: Some buses will be diverting around the closures. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 6,000 participants will take part in the annual Sutherland 2 Surf fun run and walk from Sutherland to Cronulla via the Kingsway from 7.30am. Roads around the start area will close from 5am with all closures in place by 7.40am. Roads progressively reopen from 8.20am, with all roads reopened by 10.30am.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • Sutherland from 5am: sections of Flora St and Acacia Rd. 
  • Gymea to Cronulla from 7am to 10am: the eastbound lanes of the Kingsway will be closed from the Princes Hwy to Elouera Rd, and will progressively reopen from 8.20am. The speed limit on the Kingsway westbound lanes will be reduced to 40km/h from 7am to 10.30am and delays are expected. Motorists travelling north of the Kingsway should use The Boulevarde/Captain Cook Dr. Motorists travelling south of the Kingsway should use President Ave. 
  • Kirrawee from 7am: Bath Rd South, Clements Pde, Flora St and Oak Rd. 
  • Gymea from 7am to 8.20am: Hotham Rd. From 7.20am, the Kingsway westbound lanes will be closed between Talara Rd and the Princes Hwy, and the northbound lanes of Talaea Rd will be closed between Warburton St and the Kingsway. 
  • Miranda / Caringbah from 7.30am: southbound lanes of Kiora Rd, eastbound lanes of Port Hacking Rd and Taren Point Rd. Central Rd will also be closed from 7am. 
  • Caringbah from 7am: Banksia Rd, Denman Ave, Yathong Rd. Gannons Rd will close at 7.40am. 
  • Woolooware from 7am: Dolans Rd, Fowler St and Hughes St. 
  • Cronulla from 5am: Prince St. 
  • Cronulla from 7am: Mitchell Rd and Elouera Rd. While Elouera Rd is closed between 7.30am and 9.50am, access to North Cronulla is via Captain Cook Dr, and access to South Cronulla is via President Ave and Burraneer Bay Rd. 

Motorists will still be able to cross the Kingsway at various points before and after runners pass major intersections including at Hotham Rd, Milburn Rd/Gymea Bay Rd, Manchester Rd, Sylvania Rd, Wandella Rd, Kiora Rd, Kareena Rd, Taren Point Rd and Gannons Rd.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will not be in place, however vehicles parked along the route cannot be moved while the event is underway. Greenhills car park in Cronulla will be closed from 2pm Sat 20 July until midday Sun 21 July to accommodate the event finish line.

arrangementElements.html:
Roads crossing the Kingsway will close and reopen as the event passes through, between 7.20am and 9.50am.

Motorists will be able to cross the Kingsway at locations before and after runners pass major intersections at:

  • Hotham Road before 7.20am and after 8am
  • Milburn Road/Gymea Bay Road before 7.20am and after 8.20am
  • Manchester Road before 7.20am and after 8.20am
  • Sylvania Road before 7.20am and after 8.20am
  • Wandella Road before 7.20am and after 8.40am
  • Kiora Road before 7.30am and after 8.50am
  • Kareena Road before 7.30am and after 9.10am
  • Taren Point Road before 7.40am and after 9.10am
  • Gannons Road before 7.40am and after 9.25am
  • Elourea Road before 7.30am and after 9.50am

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 7,000 people will take part in the annual Sydney Harbour 10k and 5k on Sunday 28 July.

Events start from George St in The Rocks from 7:30am. The course travels around the harbour foreshore using on and off-road pathways via Dawes Point, Millers Point, Barangaroo, King St Wharf , Darling Harbour and Pyrmont. To safely facilitate the event, road closures will be in place.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • 4am to 1pm: Circular Quay West at the OPT
  • 4:30am to 11am: George St from Alfred St to Hickson Rd, Hickson Rd from George St to Park Hyatt, and the OPT Upper Roadway
  • 6am to 10am: Hickson Rd between Napoleon St and Barton St, Sussex St between Napoleon St and Erskine St, northbound lanes of Sussex St from King St to Erskine St. Sections of Slip St and Barton St.
  • 6am to 11am: Hickson Rd from Park Hyatt to Barton St, and Napoleon St between Kent St and Sussex St. Sections of Dalgety St and Towns Pl.
  • 7.30am to 10am: Sections of Murray St & Pirrama Rd, and Wharf 7/10 Service Rd in Pyrmont.
  • 8.30am to 9:30am: Barangaroo Ave, Cuthbert St, Erskine St, King St, Lime St, Shelley St and Watermans Quay at King St Wharf.

Changed local access arrangements will be in place around King Street Wharf/Barangaroo between 8:30am and 9:15am and in Pyrmont between 7:30am and 10am. There will be no exit from the King Street Wharf area between 8:30am and 9:15am due to the closure of Sussex St. Access in via Harbour St/Wheat Rd.

arrangementElements.html:

properties.publicTransport: Additional route 199 buses will also run towards Manly and Mona Vale after the game to help you get home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Titans at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Preliminary match kick-off at 1.45pm. NRL kick-off at 4.05pm and full time around 6.05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early as parking will be in high demand, and also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Panthers v Dolphins at BlueBet Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off at 11:30am. NRL kick-off at 2pm, full time approx. 4pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as thousands of fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

AFL: GWS Giants v Gold Coast Suns at ENGIE Stadium. First bounce at 1.45pm, full time around 4.15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as footy fans travel to the precinct at the same time other events take place at nearby venues. Motorists should extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd. 

Fans who have to drive should carpool with their group and pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. Avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout and use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access car parks.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Winter Challenge Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11am, last race from 4:25pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

NRL: Rabbitohs v Tigers at Industree Group Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off at 12.40pm. NRL kick-off 3pm, full time approx. 5pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including on the Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the match.

Dane Dr will close at 11.45am between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Disney on Ice at Qudos Bank Arena from Wednesday 17 to Sunday 21 July. Wednesday sessions at 3pm & 7pm, Thursday sessions at 11am & 3pm, Friday sessions at 11am, 3pm & 7pm, Saturday sessions at 10am, 2pm & 6pm, Sunday sessions at 2pm & 6pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct. Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout and use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access car parks.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Event shuttle busues will run between Blacktown Interchange and Sydney Motorsport throughout the event. For more details, visit transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney SuperNight at Sydney Motorsport Park in Eastern Creek from Friday 19 to Sunday 21 July.

On Friday, gates open at 10am ahead of track activity from 10.45am to 6.30pm. Saturday gates open from 10.30am ahead of track activity from 12.15pm to 9.15pm, and Sunday gates open at 9am ahead of track activity from 9.30am to 5.45pm.

Motorists should allow extra time on the Great Western Hwy, M4 Mwy, M7 Mwy, Wallgrove Rd, Chandos Rd, Horsley Dr and Ferrers Rd approaching Eastern Creek over the weekend.

Limited free parking will be available at Sydney Motorsport Park. Access is via Gate D, off Ferrers Road.

Attendees should allow plenty of additional time for parking and access to the site.

roads.mainStreet: Great Western Highway, M4 Motorway, M7 Motorway, Wallgrove Rd, Ferrers Rd

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend Ali Wong: Live at ICC Sydney Theatre. Show starts at 7.30pm daily.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as attendees travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Conan Gray at ICC Sydney Theatre on Wednesday 17 July. Show starts at 8pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees travel to the event in the busy evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
International Rugby: Wallabies v Georgia at Allianz Stadium. Preliminary match kick-off from 1pm. Wallabies kick-off at 3.55pm, full time around 5.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the game.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 11.30am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. Car park open from 12.30pm. Please note that EP2 car park will not be open for this match.
  • Due to the Moore Park Road pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Rd onto Moore Park Rd westbound. Motorists can use Cook Rd for access onto Moore Park Rd instead.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am to 7pm on sections of Albion St, Fitzroy St and Moore Park Rd, and from 6am to 7pm on Cleveland St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

FROM 6AM TO 7PM

  • Cleveland Street between Abercrombie St and South Dowling Street (northern side)

FROM 11AM TO 7PM

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Broncos at McDonald Jones Stadium. Jersey Flegg from 1.15pm and NSW Cup from 3pm. NRL kick-off at 5.30pm, finish around 7.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

The Tenacious D concert will be held on Tuesday 16 July at 8pm at the Newcastle Entertainment Centre.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees travel to and from the event. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

The Walgett NAIDOC Week parade will be held on Wednesday 17 July 2024. The parade will take place between Wee Waa Street and Hope Street and will assemble on Dundas Lane at 9.30am for a 10am commencement.
properties.diversions: Road Closure of Fox St (Castlereigh Hwy) from Wee Waa St (Kamilaroi Hwy) to Hope St with detour via Peel St and Bate St.

properties.publicTransport: Additional route 199 buses will also run towards Manly and Mona Vale after the game to help you get home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Knights at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Jersey Flegg kick-off at 12pm, NSW Cup kick-off at 1.45pm. NRL kick-off at 4.05pm and full time around 6.05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early as parking will be in high demand, and also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Disney on Ice will be held at the Newcastle Entertainment Centre on Thursday 11 to Sunday 14 July.

Thursday session at 7pm, Friday sessions at 11am, 3pm & 7pm, and weekend sessions at 10am, 2pm & 6pm daily. Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the entertainment centre as attendees travel to and from the show. Allow extra travel time. Traffic controllers will be on site on Saturday and Sunday between 12 and 5pm to direct motorists.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Bastille Festival in Circular Quay from Thursday 11 to Sunday 14 July. Events run from 12pm-10pm Thursday, 10am-11pm Friday and Saturday, and 10am-8pm on Sunday.

The festival will be held at various locations around Circular Quay including Customs House (on Alfred St), Loftus St and the Gateway Plaza Forecourt areas.

The following road closures will be in place from 12pm Wednesday 10 July to 10am Monday 15 July to safely facilitate the event: 

  • Loftus S between Reiby Pl and Alfred St
  • Eastbound lanes of Custom House Ln between Loftus St and Young St

There are no Special Event Clearways for this event.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Thousands of people are expected to attend Tenacious D at ICC Sydney Theatre. Show starts at 8pm daily.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.
